title: How I Built My First Fully Functional Portfolio Website for a Hairdresser
shortContent: Sharing my experience building a fully functional portfolio website for a hairdresser, covering requirements gathering, design, and backend implementation. This project allowed me to apply skills in React, CSS modules, responsive design, and Node.js.

content.text: In this blog post, I'd like to share my experience of building a fully functional portfolio website for a hairdresser. This process involved several stages, from gathering requirements to implementing the backend. It was both a technical challenge and an opportunity to apply my skills in React, CSS modules, responsive design, and Node.js.

The project began with a discussion with my client, Taisiya, a hairdresser, to understand her vision for the website. Key requirements included: A stylish and modern design, pages for services, prices, and contact information, a booking form for clients, and the ability to add client reviews.

For flexibility and modularity, I chose React as the main frontend framework, and used CSS modules for isolated component styling. The main structure of the site included: Home (Welcome text and key services), About Us (Taisiya's story, philosophy, and a photo), Services (detailed list of services with prices), Gallery (showcase of work), Contact (booking form and contact details).

To create a responsive design, I utilized Flexbox and CSS Grid for easy layout adjustments. Special attention was given to the mobile version, adding a hamburger menu and a two-row layout for gallery filters.

The booking form was a key feature for scheduling services. I used the Yup library for validation, with fields for name, phone number, selected service, and time, ensuring proper data input before backend submission.
For client reviews and bookings, I used Node.js and MongoDB. Form data was sent to the backend, processed, and stored, handling both client bookings and reviews effectively.
The final step was deploying the site using Vercel, ensuring integration of the frontend and stable website performance.

This project provided valuable client experience, improved my technical skills, and deepened my understanding of full-stack development. Future plans include adding Google Calendar integration and user authentication for clients.

title: My Journey in Web Development: From Beginner to Frontend Developer
shortContent: Sharing my journey into web development, from my early steps to where I am today. This field has proven challenging yet fascinating, requiring not only technical skills but continuous learning and growth.

content.text: In this blog, I want to share my journey into the world of web development. Starting as a beginner, I discovered how challenging and fascinating it could be. Web development demands not just technical skills but constant learning and improvement.
My journey began with HTML and CSS, the foundation of web design. Creating headings, paragraphs, and lists, positioning elements, and understanding layouts was initially challenging but rewarding.
JavaScript was the next step, where I learned variables, conditions, loops, and DOM manipulation, enabling real-time page updates and interactivity.
Discovering React opened up new possibilities. I created components, used JSX, and managed data with states and props, transforming my ability to build interactive and complex UIs.
Exploring tools like Webpack, Babel, ESLint, and Git helped me streamline my workflow and maintain high code quality. CSS frameworks enabled faster, more responsive design.
I delved into backend development with Node.js and MongoDB to build basic servers, gaining a better understanding of server-client interactions and data management.
Practicing through projects—like a personal website and blog—solidified my skills, providing real-world experience with teamwork and client projects.
My journey in web development has been both challenging and rewarding, highlighting the importance of continuous learning and practical application.

title: Practical Project Breakdown: Solving Technical Challenges
shortContent: In this post, I'll break down projects I've tackled, highlighting how I approached and solved various technical challenges. These examples showcase effective tools and methods for handling development issues.

content.text: In this post, I'll break down several projects I've worked on and explain how I approached and solved different technical challenges.
I implemented a responsive menu with React's useRef for a dropdown on mobile, adding debounce logic to handle quick successive clicks for smooth functionality.
I used Yup for form validation to enhance user experience by providing instant feedback for errors before form submission.
For a gallery page, I implemented data fetching and filtering, enabling users to view categories with the filter method.
I built a backend with Express and MongoDB for handling bookings and reviews, ensuring asynchronous requests for optimal performance.
Each project presented unique challenges, solved by breaking problems into parts and applying effective tools. Web development requires continuous learning, and I look forward to future challenges.
